meanings.definition: The act of aligning or adjusting in a straight line or in proper order.
meanings.sent1: The eloignment of the books on the shelf made them look neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: Proper eloignment of the wheels is crucial for a smooth ride.
meanings.sent3: The eloignment of the ducks in a row was so perfect, it looked like a parade.
meanings.sent4: Her eloignment of thoughts in the essay was like a well-orchestrated symphony.
meanings.sent5: The eloignment of the stars in the night sky created a breathtaking pattern.

meanings.definition: The state of being in proper alignment or order.
meanings.sent1: The eloignment of the picture frames on the wall was pleasing to the eye.
meanings.sent2: After the adjustments, the eloignment of the gears was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The eloignment of the traffic cones seemed to form a colorful maze.
meanings.sent4: The eloignment of the dancers on stage was like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The eloignment of the planets in the solar system is a marvel of nature.
